title: Japan
summary: Citi opened its first Japanese branch in Yokohama in 1902 and has a long and proud history of serving corporate and institutional clients across a broad range of products, including corporate and investment banking, markets and securities services, capital markets origination, treasury and trade solutions, and research. The connectivity Citi provides is an important asset for Japanese clients with global aspirations.
tag-2: Citi serves top-tier Japanese multinationals, financial institutions, institutional investors and public sector entities, as well as foreign multinationals and global investors that operate or invest in Japan.
